title: What is the relationship between morality and initiatic science in esotericism?
first_phrase: This text is about the relationship between morality and esotericism, and how the latter does not necessarily require moral values in the traditional sense. The author argues that esotericism is a science that is concerned only with the laws of cause and effect, which are not inherently good or bad. The value of esotericism lies only in its ability to produce results. The author also suggests that the idea of moralizing in esotericism is a fallacy, as the conditions necessary for spiritual transformation come from within rather than external factors. The use of the term "morality" in this context can only confuse the issue, as esotericism is based on technical conditions rather than moral values.

Ma, ripetiamolo, l'uso del termine « morale » può solo confondere le idee, per ché, evidentemente, qui s'incontrano due punti di vista ben distinti: quello morale afferma che certe cose sono da farsi ed altre no in via assoluta, per una legge di bene e di male che dovrebbe valere in sè stessa; quello iniziatico considera invece un insieme di norme a cui si riconosce ii solo valore di condizioni tecniche e di strumenti per la realizzazione. Per cui anche quando queste norme in parte collimassero con quelle della morale corrente, è per ragioni affatto diverse che — come si è accennato al principio chi segue la via iniziatica può farle sue.
last_phrase: In conclusion, it is important to understand that esotericism and morality are two distinct perspectives that should not be confused with each other. While morality emphasizes absolute laws of good and evil, esotericism recognizes norms as technical conditions and tools for achieving divinization. Therefore, it is not about moralizing, but about elevating oneself to a higher level of existence through spiritual transformation and discipline, which requires a different set of guidelines than traditional morality.
